info.title: Selligent Marketing Cloud API
info.description: Click the endpoint to see details. In the Parameters-section, we show an example of how the data you send along with the api-call looks like.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get list of all medium configurations.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter mediums by medium type (Ftp, Url or Repository).

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Optional parameter to search mediums by name or description.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify index to start picking medium items from.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify count for the number of medium items to be taken.

200.description: This endpoint will retrieve list of mediums. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful retrieval in case of invalid medium type.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve a medium (Ftp/Url/Repository) details.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify medium API name.

200.description: This endpoint will retrieve the medium details with the given api name.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete a medium.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: API name of the medium to be deleted

200.description: This endpoint will delete the medium with the given api name.

examples.message: The medium has been deleted successfully

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a FTP medium.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists medium details that are to used to create the medium

200.description: This endpoint will create a new medium of FTP type. This medium will contain the parameters, specifically for the chosen medium type. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: Medium Not Created

put.summary: Use this endpoint to update a FTP medium.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: API name of the FTP medium to be updated

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists medium details that are to used to update the FTP medium

200.description: This endpoint will update a medium of FTP type. This medium will contain the parameters, specifically for the chosen medium type. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: Medium Not Updated

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a Repository medium.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists medium details that are to used to create the medium

200.description: This endpoint will create a new medium of Repository type. This medium will contain the parameters, specifically for the chosen medium type. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: Medium Not Created

put.summary: Use this endpoint to update a Repository medium.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: API name of the Repository medium to be updated

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists medium details that are to used to update the Repository medium

200.description: This endpoint will update a medium of Repository type. This medium will contain the parameters, specifically for the chosen medium type. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: Medium Not Updated

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a URL medium.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists medium details that are to used to create the medium

200.description: This endpoint will create a new medium of URL type. This medium will contain the parameters, specifically for the chosen medium type. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: Medium Not Created

put.summary: Use this endpoint to update a URL medium.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: API name of the URL medium to be updated

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists medium details that are to used to update the URL medium

200.description: This endpoint will update a medium of URL type. This medium will contain the parameters, specifically for the chosen medium type. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: Medium Not Updated

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve all the notification groups.

200.description: This endpoint will return a list of notification groups.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a new notification group.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists notification group details that are to used to create the notification group

200.description: This endpoint will create a new notification group.

400.description: Notification group not created.

put.summary: Use this endpoint to update the properties of the notification group.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: API name of the notification group to be updated

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists notification group details that are to used to update the notification group

200.description: This endpoint will update the properties of the notification group.

400.description: Notification group not updated.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete a notification group.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: API name of the notification group to be deleted

200.description: This endpoint will delete the notification group with the given api name.

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful delete of notification group.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details of this organization set up on your instance of Selligent Marketing Cloud.

200.description: This endpoint will return an object with the main properties of the organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

get.summary: API to check whether content already exists.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the content.

200.description: This endpoint will return a content-object defined on the given organization with the given api-name. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

delete.summary: API to delete existing content.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the content.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the content with the given api name.

examples.message: The content has been deleted successfully

post.summary: API to create simple (only html) single language message of email.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: This CreateEmailMessageModel model have information related to email message

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Parameter indicating whether the content should be published. [Default: false]

200.description: Email message content created

examples.message: The Email message has been created successfully.

400.description: Email message content Not created

post.summary: API to create Mobile push message for creating content.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: This CreateMobileMessageModel model have information related to Mobile push content

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Parameter indicating whether the content should be published. [Default: false]

examples.message: The Mobile message has been created successfully.

400.description: Mobile message content Not created

post.summary: API to create simple (only html) single language page content.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: This CreatePageModel model have information related to Mobile push content

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Parameter indicating whether the content should be published. [Default: false]

examples.message: The Page content has been created successfully.

400.description: Page content Not created

post.summary: API to create a SMS Content

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: This CreateSMSModel model have information related to SMS content

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Parameter indicating whether the content should be published. [Default: false]

examples.message: The SMS message has been created successfully.

400.description: Sms content Not created

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete a data export.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: API name of the data export to be deleted

200.description: This endpoint will delete the data export with the given api name.

examples.message: Data export has been deleted successfully.

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful delete of data export.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete a data import.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: API name of the data import to be deleted

200.description: This endpoint will delete the data import with the given api name.

examples.message: Data import has been deleted successfully.

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful delete of data import.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve an overview of all journeys set up in the given organization.

200.description: This endpoint will return an list of objects with the main properties of the organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to check whether AB journey already exists.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the AB journey.

200.description: This endpoint will return a AB journey-object defined on the given organization with the given api-name. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete existing AB journey.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the AB journey.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the AB journey with the given api name.

examples.message: The journey has been deleted successfully

get.summary: Use this endpoint to check whether custom journey already exists.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the custom journey.

200.description: This endpoint will return a custom journey-object defined on the given organization with the given api-name. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete existing custom journey.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the custom journey.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the custom journey with the given api name.

examples.message: The journey has been deleted successfully

get.summary: Lists all entry point components in the custom journey, usable via api.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: the api name of the custom journey.

200.description: An overview of all available entry points within the custom journey and usable via api. All other type of entry points are not listed here.

examples.system_info: some optional system information about the entry point.

model.name: My name of the entry point

404.description: when no custom journey exists for the api_name.

get.summary: Gets detailed information about the entry point component.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: the api name of the custom journey

parameters.name: entrypoint_api_name
parameters.description: the api name of the entry point defined in the custom journey.

200.description: Returns detailed information about a specific entry point within the custom journey and usable via api.

examples.system_info: some optional system information about the entry point.

model.name: My name of the entry point

404.description: when the combination of api_name and entrypoint_api_name did not resulted in succes.

post.summary: This will trigger a specific start component in the custom journey

200.description: Trigger a specific start component in the custom journey.

404.description: the requested resource does not exist on the server.

400.description: When an error occurs the response contains more information about the error(s).

errors.description: entry point could not be triggerd, timeout.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to check whether recurring journey already exists.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the recurring journey.

200.description: This endpoint will return a recurring journey-object defined on the given organization with the given api-name. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete existing recurring journey.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the recurring journey.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the recurring journey with the given api name.

examples.message: The journey has been deleted successfully

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve all journeys on the given organization of type Single Batch.

200.description: This endpoint will return a list of single batch journey-objects defined on the given organization. Check “Model” for the object-structure.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a new Single-Batch journey.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The parameters required for the creation of the execution. journey.scheduling.launch_date is required, if journey.launch_state is "Schedule". journey.send_in_waves.type can be "Waves" or "Items". journey.sending_limit.type can be "Absolute" or "Relative". journey.sending_limit.sort_selection can be "Random" or "Sorted".

201.description: This endpoint will create a new single batch journey. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: No (or invalid) id or model data has been provided

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve information on the Single Batch journey with the given api name.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: The name of the instance to get

200.description: This endpoint will return a single batch journey-object defined on the given organization with the given api-name. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete existing single batch journey.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the single batch journey.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the single batch journey with the given api name.

examples.message: The journey has been deleted successfully

post.summary: Use this endpoint to cancel launching of a journey

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Api name for the journey to be cancelled.

200.description: Journey has been cancelled successfully

examples.message: The journey has been cancelled successfully.

400.description: Journey cancel was not successful

404.description: Journey (api_name or organization) cannot be found

post.summary: Use this endpoint to launch a journey

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Api name for the journey to be launched.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Request model providing launch state and scheduling info. journey.scheduling.launch_date is required if journey.launch_state is "Schedule".

200.description: Journey has been launched successfully

examples.message: The journey has been launched successfully.

400.description: Journey launch was not successful

404.description: Journey (api_name or organization) cannot be found

post.summary: Use this endpoint to trigger a Single-Batch journey execution.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: The name of the execution that should be triggered.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Optionally, extra parameters required for triggering the execution can be provided through the model. journey.scheduling.launch_date is required if journey.launch_state is "Schedule".

400.description: No (or invalid) id or model data has been provided

201.description: This endpoint will trigger the execution of the single batch journey with the given api-name. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

post.summary: Use this end point to send single batch with email message

parameters.name: requestModel
parameters.description: Request model to send single batch with email message. journey.scheduling.launch_date is required if journey.launch_state is "Schedule". journey.send_in_waves.type can be "Waves" or "Items". journey.sending_limit.type can be "Absolute" or "Relative". journey.sending_limit.sort_selection can be "Random" or "Sorted".

200.description: This endpoint will create a new single batch journey with email message. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: No (or invalid) id or model data has been provided

post.summary: Use this endpoint to send single batch mobile push message

parameters.name: requestModel
parameters.description: Request model providing journey info and mobile push message info. journey.scheduling.launch_date is required if journey.launch_state is "Schedule". journey.send_in_waves.type can be "Waves" or "Items". journey.sending_limit.type can be "Absolute" or "Relative". journey.sending_limit.sort_selection can be "Random" or "Sorted".

200.description: This endpoint will create a new single batch journey with mobile push content. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: No (or invalid) id or model data has been provided

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a new Single-Batch journey for Sms content

parameters.name: requestModel
parameters.description: Request model providing journey and sms content details. journey.scheduling.launch_date is required if journey.launch_state is "Schedule". journey.send_in_waves.type can be "Waves" or "Items".journey.sending_limit.type can be "Absolute" or "Relative". journey.sending_limit.sort_selection can be "Random" or "Sorted".

200.description: This endpoint will create a new single batch journey with sms content. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: No (or invalid) id or model data has been provided

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve all journeys on the given organization of type Transactional.

200.description: This endpoint will return a list of the transactional journeys defined on the organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve information on the transactional journey with the given api name.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: The name of the instance to get

200.description: This endpoint will return a journey-object defined on the given organization with the given api-name. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete existing transactional journey.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the transactional journey.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the transactional journey with the given api name.

examples.message: The journey has been deleted successfully

post.summary: Use this endpoint to send (multiple) transactional messages (email, mobile push, sms).

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: The name of execution that should be sent

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model containing the data that should be sent

200.description: This endpoint can be used to trigger the transactional message with the given api-name on the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

post.summary: Use this method to trigger a bulk journey in a transactional way

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: The name of execution that should be sent

200.description: The provided model is valid. The response will contain information on whether or not the action was executed successful.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to update the user profile with given data and then send (multiple) transactional messages (email, mobile push, sms).

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: The name of execution that should be sent

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model containing the data that should be sent

200.description: This endpoint can be used to create and/or update a user-profile and then trigger the transactional message with the given api-name on the given organization for this user. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to get the status of multiple transactional messages.

200.description: This endpoint will return a list of transactional-status-objects for the messages that correspond to the list of guids that is submitted, for the transactional journeys defined on the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get the status of a transactional message with a given id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the ID of the message

200.description: This endpoint will return a transactional-status-object for the transactional journey with the given id on the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to retrieve an overview of all of the lists set up in the given organization.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter list by type. (Userlist, Datalist, Dataselectionlist or Optionlist)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Optional parameter to search a list with a specific name, description or tags.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify index to start picking list items from.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify count for the number of list items to be taken.

200.description: This endpoint will return a list of lists defined on the organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a new list in the given organization.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: This CreateListRequestModel model parameter having information about list as name, api_name, listType, description and tags to be created .

200.description: This endpoint will create a new list of the given type. This list will contain the default fields, specifically for the chosen list type. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: List Not Created

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get a list of details for the list with the given by API name.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the list

200.description: This endpoint will return a list-object defined on the given organization with the given api-name. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

put.summary: Use this endpoint to update a list

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter for API name associated with a list

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: This UpdateListRequestModel model parameter having information about list as name, api_name, listType, description and tags to be updated .

200.description: Calling this endpoint will update properties and settings of the list with the given api-name.Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: No (or invalid) id or model data has been provided

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete a list by its API name in the given organization.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: dropTable
parameters.description: Optional Parameter to specify if the associated table is to be deleted.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the list with the given api-name in the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure that will be returned.

examples.message: The list has been deleted successfully

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful delete of list.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get custom events

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: api name of the list on which all custom event are requested.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Optional parameter to search a custom event with a specific name, description or tags.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify index to start picking custom event items from.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify count for the number of custom event items to be taken.

200.description: This endpoint will retrieve list of custom events. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a new custom event.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists custom event details that are to used to create the custom event

200.description: This endpoint will create a new custom event.

examples.message: The custom event has been saved successfully.

400.description: Custom event not created.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get custom event details based on list API name and custom event name.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: custom_event_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify name of the custom event.

200.description: This endpoint will return a custom-event-object with the details of the custom event with the given custom-event-name in the list with the given api-name defined on the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

put.summary: Use this endpoint to update a custom event.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: custom_event_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify custom event name to be updated.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists custom event details that are to used to update the custom event

200.description: This endpoint will update the custom event.

examples.message: The custom event has been updated successfully.

400.description: Custom event not updated.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete a custom event by its name in the given organization.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: custom_event_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify name of the custom event.

parameters.name: dropTable
parameters.description: Optional Parameter to specify if the associated table is to be deleted.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the custom event with the given custom-event-name in the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure that will be returned.

examples.message: The custom event has been deleted successfully

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful deletion of custom event.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get custom event fields based on list API name and custom event name.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: custom_event_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify name of the custom event.

200.description: This endpoint will return a custom-event-field-object with the custom event fields for given custom-event-name in the list with the given api-name defined on the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

fields.name: field_1
fields.description: This is a field of type text.

fields.name: field_2
fields.description: This is a field of type numeric.

fields.name: field_3
fields.description: This is a field of type text with text optionlist association.

fields.name: field_4
fields.description: This is a field of type numeric with numeric optionlist association.

fields.name: field_5
fields.description: This is a field of type boolean.

fields.name: field_6
fields.description: This is a field of type text.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create a custom event fields.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: custom_event_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify custom event name to be updated.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists custom event details that are to used to create a custom event field

200.description: This endpoint will update the custom event.

400.description: Custom event not updated.

put.summary: Use this endpoint to update a custom event field.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: custom_event_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify custom event name.

parameters.name: field_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify custom event field name to be updated

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model object consists custom event field details that are to used to update a custom event field

200.description: This endpoint will update the custom event field.

examples.message: The custom event field has been updated successfully.

400.description: Custom event field not updated.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete a custom event field based on list's API name, custom event name and name of the field

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list.

parameters.name: custom_event_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify name of the custom event.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify name of the custom event field.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the custom event field with the given custom-event-name and field name in the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure that will be returned.

examples.message: The custom event field has been deleted successfully

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful deletion of custom event field.

errors.description: Failed to delete custom event field.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create or update a single record with data on a 1:1 relation

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the list.

parameters.name: keyfields
parameters.description: Parameter contains a comma-separated list of the key fields that need to be used to create or update records.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Parameter contains a key value pair dictionary of the master record data or slave record data.

200.description: This endpoint upsert a single list data record on 1:1 relation with the given list-api-name in the list with the given api-name in the given organization.

examples.message: Record ID 13 inserted on List DataApiOneToOne_A. Record ID 21 inserted on Relation NAMEREL.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete data from a specific table.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the list.

parameters.name: keyFields
parameters.description: Parameter contains a comma-separated list of the key fields that need to be used to delete records.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Parameter indicates a comma-separated list of the fields that are in the provided data records.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the mode of the data transfer (Sync or Stream). [Default: Sync]

parameters.name: errorHandling
parameters.description: Parameter indicates error handling options whether to stop on error or continue on error

200.description: This endpoint deletes data from the list with the given api-name in the given organization. Deleting data can be done synchronous or streamed.The data provided in the message body should be in Json format.e.g. [ ["SOMEKEYFIELD", "SOMEOTHERKEYFIELD", "SOMEOTHERFIELD"], [1, "jane.doe@example.net", "Some random data 1"], [2, "john.doe@example.net", "Some random data 2"] ]. Check “Model” for the object-structure that will be returned.

invalid_records.message: Record contains incorrect number of fields

post.summary: Use this endpoint to load data into a specific table.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the list.

parameters.name: keyFields
parameters.description: Parameter contains a comma-separated list of the key fields that need to be used to create or update records.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Optional parameter containing a comma-separated list of the fields that are in the provided data records. Make sure that this list contains ALL fields (including the key fields) in the correct order. If this parameter is not provided, the first row of the provided data records will be used to determine the fields.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the mode of the data transfer (Sync or Stream). [Default: Sync]

parameters.name: deduplication
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the de-duplication option during an import data (ImportLastMatch or ImportFirstMatch). [Default: ImportLastMatch]

parameters.name: data_import_option
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the data import option during an import data (InsertAndUpdate or OnlyInsert or OnlyUpdate). [Default: InsertAndUpdate]

parameters.name: create_segment_name
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the name of segment at the time of segment creation

parameters.name: create_segment_api_name
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the api name of segment at the time of segment creation

parameters.name: errorHandling
parameters.description: Parameter indicates error handling options whether to stop on error or continue on error

200.description: This endpoint loads data into the list with the given api-name in the given organization. Loading data can be done synchronous or streamed. The data provided in the message body should be in Json format.e.g. [ ["SOMEID", "SOMESTRING", "SOMEDATE", "SOMEFLOAT", "SOMEGUID", "SOMEBOOL"], [1, "Some String 1", "2018 -03-27T11:57:20.1179032Z", 3.14, "42ccbae0-d4fe-4d5f-b46e-1c6859d14524", false], [2, "Some String 2", "2018 -03-27T11:57:20.1234186Z", 6.28, "2d33b365-1008-4407-a818-dab8e46fbf40", true] ]. The first line, containing the columns is optional and should ONLY be provided if the fields are not provided in the query string. Note that if the fields are provided in the query string, the first row will be considered as regular data. Check “Model” for the object-structure that will be returned.

invalid_records.message: Length of string (53) exceeds maximum field length (50)
Record contains incorrect number of fields

post.summary:
Use this endpoint to search for data records in a specific table.
Searching data can be done synchronous or streamed.
The data in the response will be in a Json format.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents the API name of the list.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Parameter specifies the details on the data that should be searched.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the mode of the data transfer (Sync or Stream). [Default: Sync]

200.description: OK

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get all relations associated with a list.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter for API name associated with a list

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter relations by type. (OneToOne, OneToMany or ManyToOne)

200.description: Relations between lists allow you to store additional information that cannot be stored in the main list. These are the 3 major relationships:  • 1:1(profile extensions) — Used for selection and personalization.It can be considered as a expansion of your audience list. • 1:N(lookup tables)— Used only for selections, not personalization.  • N: 1 — Used to link multiple records in the master list to one single record in the linked list. A typical example of this is when family members are linked to one single address. This endpoint will return a list of relation - objects of the relations defined on the list with the given api - name in the given organization.Check “Model” for the object - structure.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to create relations between 2 lists.

201.description: This endpoint will add relations to the list with the given api-name. Multiple relations can be created in a single call. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: No (or invalid) id or model data has been provided

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get relation details based on API name of the list and name of the relation.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Parameter to specify scope name of the relation

200.description: This endpoint will return a relations-object with the details of the relation with the given scope and api-name defined on the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

put.summary: Use this endpoint to update an existing relation between the given list and a linked list.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of list

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Parameter to specify name of relation

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Object to specify updates to a relation

200.description: Calling this endpoint will update the relation with the given scope in the list with the given api-name. All properties can be changed. Do note that changing these may affect the behaviour of journey tasks based on the updated relation. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

400.description: No (or invalid) api_name or scope has been provided or unable to update relation

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete a relation between this list and another.

200.description: This endpoint will delete the field relation the given scope in the list with the given api-name in the given organization. Deleting a relation is not possible if the relation is used on a bounce - list.Deleting relations that are(only) used in content or expressions will break this content and expressions.Check “Model” for the object - structure that will be returned.

examples.message: The relation has been deleted successfully

400.description: No (or invalid) api_name or scope has been provided or unable to delete relation

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get an overview of the segments defined on the given list.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: api name of the List for which segments are requested.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional parameter to filter segment by type.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Optional parameter to search a segment with a specific name, description or tags.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify index to start picking segment items from.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Optional parameter to specify count for the number of segment items to be taken.

200.description: A list segment contains a fraction of the data of a list.These are the 2 segment types:•	Dynamic segment — These segments are created from scratch, based on a filter being defined on a user list.The records in this type of segment evolve over time, depending on new records complying with the criteria or existing records that no longer answer the filter criteria.•	Static segment — This type of segment contains a fixed set of data.It can be created in multiple ways.When the static segment is derived from a dynamic segment, it contains a snapshot of the records currently in the dynamic segment.When the static segment is created through the import of a file, it contains a fixed set of records as well.This endpoint will return a list of segments defined on the list with the given api - name in the given organization.Check “Model” for the object - structure.

get.summary: Use this endpoint to get segment details based on list API name and segment API name.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the list

parameters.name: segment_api_name
parameters.description: Parameter to specify API name of the segment

200.description: This endpoint will return a segment-object with the details of the segment with the given segment-api-name in the list with the given api-name defined on the given organization. Check “Model” for the object - structure.

parameters.name: segment_api_name

examples.message: The segment has been deleted successfully

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful deletion of segment.

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to delete data from a specific static segment.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the list.

parameters.name: segment_api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the segment.

parameters.name: keyFields
parameters.description: Parameter contains a comma-separated list of the key fields that need to be used to delete records.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Parameter indicates a comma-separated list of the fields that are in the provided data records.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the mode of the data transfer (Sync or Stream). [Default: Sync]

parameters.name: errorHandling
parameters.description: Parameter indicates error handling options whether to stop on error or continue on error

200.description: This endpoint deletes data via json from the segment with the given segment-api-name in the list with the given api-name in the given organization. Deleting data can be done synchronous or streamed. The data provided in the message body should be in Json format.e.g. [ ["SOMEKEYFIELD", "SOMEOTHERKEYFIELD", "SOMEOTHERFIELD"], [1,"jane.doe@example.net", "Some random data 1"], [2, "john.doe@example.net", "Some random data 2"] ]. Do note that this delete will only delete the references to the records from the segment. The original records remain untouched. Check “Model” for the object-structure that will be returned.

invalid_records.message: Record contains incorrect number of fields

delete.summary: Use this endpoint to clear static segment data

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter for API name associated with a list

parameters.name: segment_api_name
parameters.description: Parameter for API name associated with a segment

200.description: This endpoint will clear the static segment data with the given list api-name and segment api-name in the given organization.

examples.message: The data has been cleared successfully.

400.description: Represents a response for an unsuccessful clear static segment data.

errors.description: Failed to clear static segment data.

post.summary: Use this endpoint to load data into a specific static segment.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the list.

parameters.name: segment_api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents API name of the segment.

parameters.name: keyFields
parameters.description: Parameter contains a comma-separated list of the key fields that need to be used to create or update records.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Optional parameter containing a comma-separated list of the fields that are in the provided data records. Make sure that this list contains ALL fields (including the key fields) in the correct order. If this parameter is not provided, the first row of the provided data records will be used to determine the fields.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the mode of the data transfer (Sync or Stream). [Default: Sync]

parameters.name: deduplication
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the de-duplication option during an import data (ImportLastMatch or ImportFirstMatch). [Default: ImportLastMatch]

parameters.name: errorHandling
parameters.description: Parameter indicates error handling options whether to stop on error or continue on error

200.description: This endpoint loads data into the segment with the given segment-api-name in the list with the given api-name in the given organization. Loading data can be done synchronous or streamed.The data provided in the message body should be in Json format.e.g. [ ["SOMEID", "SOMESTRING", "SOMEDATE", "SOMEFLOAT", "SOMEGUID", "SOMEBOOL"], [1, "Some String 1", "2018 -03-27T11:57:20.1179032Z", 3.14, "42ccbae0-d4fe-4d5f-b46e-1c6859d14524", false], [2, "Some String 2", "2018 -03-27T11:57:20.1234186Z", 6.28, "2d33b365-1008-4407-a818-dab8e46fbf40", true] ]. The first line, containing the columns is optional and should ONLY be provided if the fields are not provided in the query string. Note that if the fields are provided in the query string, the first row will be considered as regular data. Check “Model” for the object-structure that will be returned.

invalid_records.message: Length of string (53) exceeds maximum field length (50)
Record contains incorrect number of fields

post.summary:
Use this endpoint to search for data records within a segment of a specific table.
Searching data can be done synchronous or streamed.
The data in the response will be in a Json format.

parameters.name: api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents the API name of the list.

parameters.name: segment_api_name
parameters.description: Parameter represents the API name of the segment.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Parameter specifies the details on the data that should be searched.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Parameter indicates the mode of the data transfer (Sync or Stream). [Default: Sync]

200.description: OK
